tools.name: ChatGPT
tools.description: AI conversational assistant that answers questions, explains concepts, and helps generate essays, summaries, and study plans.

tools.name: GitHub Copilot
tools.description: AI pair programmer that suggests code completions, entire functions, and helps learn programming patterns.

tools.name: Replit Ghostwriter
tools.description: In-editor AI assistant for writing, debugging, and explaining code with runnable examples.

tools.name: Khanmigo (Khan Academy AI)
tools.description: Personalized AI tutor embedded in Khan Academy to explain problems step-by-step and provide practice recommendations.

tools.name: Grammarly
tools.description: Checks grammar, clarity, tone and gives writing suggestions for essays, reports and emails.

tools.name: QuillBot
tools.description: Paraphrase text, summarize long passages, and help refine study notes quickly.

tools.name: Notion AI
tools.description: Generative features for note-taking, flashcards, meeting summaries and study organization.

tools.name: Obsidian (with AI plugins)
tools.description: Local-first knowledge base; use AI plugins to summarize, create flashcards, and build study maps.

tools.name: Socratic by Google
tools.description: Take a photo of a problem and get step-by-step explanations, helpful for math and science homework.

tools.name: Wolfram Alpha
tools.description: Computational engine for mathematics, physics, statistics and data analysis with step-by-step solutions.

tools.name: CoderPad AI
tools.description: Platform for live coding interviews and practice with AI hints and test-case generation.

tools.name: LeetCode (AI solutions)
tools.description: Large catalog of coding problems; AI-powered explanations and personalized practice paths.

tools.name: Explain Like I’m Five (ELI5) Tools
tools.description: AI tools and plugins that simplify complex topics into easy-to-understand explanations and analogies.

tools.name: Perplexity.ai
tools.description: AI search and answer engine that provides concise answers with source links — great for quick research.

tools.name: Elicit
tools.description: AI research assistant for literature review, paper summarization and extracting key findings.

tools.name: Paperpal
tools.description: Helps students draft, proofread and format academic manuscripts, with language polishing and suggestions.

tools.name: SMMRY
tools.description: Simple summarization tool to reduce long articles or chapters into concise bullet points for revision.

tools.name: MindMeister
tools.description: Create visual mind maps to organize topics, plan essays, or outline projects — helps with memory retention.

tools.name: Miro
tools.description: Collaborative whiteboard for flowcharts, diagrams, and group brainstorming sessions for assignments.

tools.name: Canva (AI Presentation)
tools.description: Design presentations, slides and visuals quickly using AI templates and design suggestions.

tools.name: Beautiful.ai
tools.description: AI-powered presentation tool that helps create professional slide decks from outlines.

tools.name: Diagram Generator (diagrams.net)
tools.description: Free tool (draw.io) for generating diagrams, flowcharts and technical schematics for projects.

tools.name: Runway ML
tools.description: Creative AI suite for image and video generation useful for multimedia projects and portfolios.

tools.name: Stable Diffusion (via multiple UIs)
tools.description: Open-source image generation model accessible through web UIs to create visuals for assignments.

tools.name: Hemingway Editor
tools.description: Improves readability by highlighting complex sentences and passive voice — great for essays and reports.

tools.name: Zotero
tools.description: Collect, organize and cite research sources easily — integrates with word processors.

tools.name: Mendeley
tools.description: Reference manager and academic social network to store PDFs, annotate and collaborate on literature.

tools.name: Anki
tools.description: Spaced repetition flashcards to memorise facts, formulas and vocabulary efficiently.

tools.name: Brainscape
tools.description: Adaptive flashcard platform for timed practice and cumulative learning across subjects.

tools.name: Socratic Question Solver (Web aggregators)
tools.description: Aggregated tools that explain textbook problems and provide stepwise approaches for exam practice.

tools.name: Physics Wallah (PW) Resources
tools.description: Courses, PDFs and video lectures for competitive exam aspirants in India (JEE/NEET) and general subjects.

tools.name: Testbook
tools.description: Mock tests, previous year question papers and detailed solutions for government and competitive exams.

tools.name: Gradeup (BYJU's Exam Prep)
tools.description: Live classes, quizzes and test series across a wide range of entrance and competitive exams.

tools.name: IndiaBIX
tools.description: Huge archive of aptitude questions, solved examples and interview practice problems.

tools.name: NTA (Official) - Exam Notices & PYQs
tools.description: Official portal for national testing agency exams, admit cards, and previous year papers.

tools.name: e-Pathshala
tools.description: Government-run repository of textbooks and study material in PDF format for school-level students.

tools.name: National Digital Library of India (NDLI)
tools.description: Centralised digital library with textbooks, articles, theses and previous year papers for students.

tools.name: Exam-specific PYQ hubs (IITJEE/NEET/UPSC)
tools.description: Aggregated previous year question papers across boards and competitive exams with solutions and downloads.

tools.name: MYLIBRARY (University Repositories)
tools.description: Collections of lecture notes, course PDFs and sample papers provided by universities and professors.

tools.name: Google Scholar
tools.description: Search academic literature for research projects, citations and scholarly articles.

tools.name: Class Central
tools.description: Search and compare free and paid online courses from top providers to build skills and certificates.

tools.name: Coursera
tools.description: University-backed online courses and specializations to upskill for internships and jobs.

tools.name: edX
tools.description: High-quality MOOCs from universities that help build domain knowledge and credentials.

tools.name: Udemy
tools.description: Large marketplace of practical courses for specific skills like web dev, ML, design and more.

tools.name: LinkedIn Learning
tools.description: Short professional courses focused on business, tech and creative skills; integrates with LinkedIn profiles.

tools.name: Internshala
tools.description: Popular Indian platform listing internships across domains, remote internships and student-friendly roles.

tools.name: AngelList (Wellfound)
tools.description: Startup jobs and internships — filter for remote, paid and early-career friendly roles.

tools.name: Handshake
tools.description: Campus-focused job platform connecting students with employers and internship opportunities.

tools.name: ScholarshipPortal
tools.description: Search scholarships and grants worldwide by level, country and field of study.

tools.name: Chegg Study
tools.description: Step-by-step solutions for textbook problems, expert Q&A and study help (subscription-based).

tools.name: Byju's Classes
tools.description: Video lectures, practice and revision material for school and competitive exams (India-centric).

tools.name: Scribe AI (Notes to Summary)
tools.description: Upload long notes or lecture transcripts and get concise summaries, bullet points and flashcards.

tools.name: PaperDrop (PDF search)
tools.description: Search and download lecture notes, solved papers and PDFs uploaded by educators and students.

tools.name: OpenStax
tools.description: Peer-reviewed, openly licensed textbooks (free) for college courses in multiple disciplines.

tools.name: Project Gutenberg
tools.description: Free eBook library ideal for literature, humanities and reference reading materials.

tools.name: Swayam
tools.description: Indian government MOOC platform offering free course material and certification across universities.

tools.name: Resume.io
tools.description: Template-based resume builder with tips and content suggestions to tailor resumes for roles.

tools.name: Canva Resume Builder
tools.description: Designer templates and AI suggestions to build eye-catching resumes and portfolios quickly.

tools.name: FlowCV
tools.description: Simple and free resume builder focused on content-first resumes tailored to recruiters.

tools.name: Resume Worded
tools.description: Automated resume feedback and scoring with suggestions to improve recruiter fit and ATS compatibility.

tools.name: Pramp
tools.description: Peer-to-peer mock interview platform for coding, system design and behavioral interviews.

tools.name: InterviewBit
tools.description: Guided interview prep with interview experiences, coding problems and company-wise tracks.

tools.name: Glassdoor
tools.description: Company reviews, salary insights and interview questions to prepare for placements and internships.

tools.name: Kaggle
tools.description: Datasets, kernels and competitions to practice machine learning and data analysis skills.

tools.name: Fast.ai
tools.description: Practical deep learning courses and a supportive community to build ML projects and portfolios.

tools.name: HackerRank
tools.description: Practice coding problems and take part in contests; company-specific prep resources available.

tools.name: Codecademy
tools.description: Hands-on interactive coding courses that teach languages and development workflows from scratch.

tools.name: Brilliant
tools.description: Active problem-solving courses for math, physics and computer science to build intuition.

tools.name: Scribd (Study Docs)
tools.description: Large library of study guides, solved papers and notes; subscription-based access for some content.

tools.name: PDF Drive
tools.description: Search engine for free PDFs, textbooks and guides useful for coursework and exam prep.

tools.name: OpenAI Codex (APIs)
tools.description: Model APIs for code generation, understanding and building coding tools or automation for study tasks.

tools.name: Scholarships.com
tools.description: Database of scholarships and financial aid opportunities for undergraduate and graduate students.

tools.name: FastCompany (Student Resources)
tools.description: Articles and guides on internships, résumé building and early career strategies for students.

tools.name: OpenAI Playground
tools.description: Experiment with large language models for generating study notes, practice questions and explanations.

tools.name: TED-Ed
tools.description: Short animated lessons and explanatory videos for a variety of academic and curiosity-driven topics.

tools.name: YouTube EDU
tools.description: Educational playlists, lecture series and tutorial channels across subjects and competitive exams.

tools.name: Socratic PYQ Aggregator
tools.description: Aggregates previous year papers and mock test links from trusted sources for quick practice and download.

tools.name: Toppr
tools.description: Interactive learning platform with tests, notes and video lessons for school and competitive exams.

tools.name: Adda247
tools.description: Comprehensive mock tests, live classes and solved PYQs for banking, SSC and other government exams.

tools.name: Vedantu
tools.description: Live interactive classes for school and entrance exam preparation with doubt-solving sessions.

tools.name: TL;DR AI (Auto Summaries)
tools.description: Automatically generate TL;DRs and study-friendly summaries from long chapters and articles.

tools.name: Socratic Scan (mobile)
tools.description: Mobile-first tool: scan textbook problems and receive AI hints, worked solutions and short explanations.

tools.name: Exam Countdown & Planner Tools
tools.description: Online planners that create study timetables, revision calendars and track progress with reminders.

tools.name: PrepAI Question Generator
tools.description: Generate practice questions, quizzes and mock tests from chapters or uploaded notes for self-testing.

tools.name: MyStudyLife
tools.description: Cross-platform planner for students to manage classes, assignments and revision schedules.

tools.name: Socratic Tutor Bots (Discord/Telegram)
tools.description: Community-driven bots and groups that provide fast answers, PYQs and shared notes from peers.

tools.name: Google Drive (Study Folder Templates)
tools.description: Organize lecture PDFs, PYQs and shared notes with templates for academic organization.

tools.name: Dropbox Paper
tools.description: Collaborative documents for group projects, meeting notes and shared revision plans.

tools.name: PeerScholar (Peer review)
tools.description: Platforms that help students get feedback on essays and projects from peers and tutors.

tools.name: Google Forms (Quiz Maker)
tools.description: Create quick mock tests and quizzes for self-assessment and group practice sessions.

tools.name: ProProfs Quiz Maker
tools.description: Build timed online mock tests with analytics for performance improvement.

tools.name: Top Companies PYQ Bank
tools.description: Collections of company-specific previous interview questions and take-home tasks to practice for placements.

tools.name: GitHub Student Pack
tools.description: Free and discounted tools for students including cloud credits, design tools and developer services.

tools.name: Google Career Certificates
tools.description: Professional certificates to build job-ready skills in IT support, data analytics and UX design.

tools.name: Patent and Project Portfolios (student tools)
tools.description: Tools and templates to prepare project portfolios and document research outcomes for applications.

tools.name: Scholarship Search (Local & International)
tools.description: Aggregators that list scholarships, eligibility criteria and deadline reminders for students worldwide.

tools.name: Upwork (Freelance for Students)
tools.description: Find short-term projects and freelance gigs to build experience and earn while studying.

tools.name: Fiverr
tools.description: Offer services like design, content writing and coding as a student to build a portfolio and earn.

tools.name: Skillshare
tools.description: Short project-based courses in design, photography, video and business to build creative portfolios.

tools.name: ResearchGate
tools.description: Connect with researchers, find papers and request full texts for research assignments and projects.

tools.name: Google Colab
tools.description: Run Python notebooks in the cloud, experiment with ML models and share reproducible code for projects.

tools.name: Chegg Math Solver
tools.description: Step-by-step solutions and calculators for math problems to verify workings and understand methods.

tools.name: SAS Learning
tools.description: Training and certifications in analytics and data science useful for CV building and internships.

tools.name: Microsoft Learn
tools.description: Free learning paths and certifications in Azure, Microsoft 365 and other technologies to boost employability.

tools.name: Codecov & CI Tools for Student Projects
tools.description: Platforms that help students add testing, CI and code quality badges to project portfolios.

tools.name: Project Gutenberg (study classics)
tools.description: Free public domain books for literature courses and humanities reading lists.

tools.name: FutureLearn
tools.description: Short online courses from universities and cultural institutions to gain micro-credentials.

tools.name: MockTest Engines (generic)
tools.description: Multiple vendor mock test engines that simulate exam environments for time and stress practice.

tools.name: OpenReview (conferences)
tools.description: Find call-for-papers, open reviews and community discussion useful for research-oriented students.

tools.name: Turnitin (plagiarism check)
tools.description: Industry-standard plagiarism detection tool often used by universities to ensure academic integrity.

tools.name: Citation Machine
tools.description: Generate properly formatted citations (APA, MLA, Chicago) for essays and research assignments.

tools.name: LanguageTool
tools.description: Multilingual grammar, style and spell-checker for non-native English speakers and multilingual students.

tools.name: PaperDrive (AI PDF summarizer)
tools.description: Upload long PDFs and receive chapter-wise summaries and key-point extraction for fast revision.

tools.name: Scholarcy
tools.description: Summarize academic papers automatically into highlights, flashcards and structured summaries.

tools.name: Papers with Code
tools.description: Find academic papers together with open-source code implementations — great for ML projects.

tools.name: Mindomo
tools.description: Create structured mind maps that can be converted into outlines and study notes.

tools.name: ExamComplaints & Discussion Forums
tools.description: Forums where students share PYQs, exam experiences, answer keys and unofficial discussions.
